trans-unit.source: The email setup starts with defining Email Distribution Codes to which multiple email settings can be assigned. The Email Distribution Codes page is accessed from the Departments menu by clicking Administration > Application Setup > General.

seg-source.mrk: The email setup starts with defining Email Distribution Codes to which multiple email settings can be assigned.
The Email Distribution Codes page is accessed from the Departments menu by clicking Administration > Application Setup > General.

trans-unit.source: As illustrated in Fig. 1, separate codes can be set up for different departments or processes. The different email settings are then defined in the Email Distribution Setup page, accessed by clicking Setup on the ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#:" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 1</MadCap:xref>, separate codes can be set up for different departments or processes.
The different email settings are then defined in the Email Distribution Setup page, accessed by clicking Setup on the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: In the Email Distribution Setup page, the usage of Outlook or SMTP Mail can be defined as well as standard Recipients, Subject line format, or special usage filters like Customer/Vendor/Contact /Responsibility Center and Language Code.

seg-source.mrk: In the Email Distribution Setup page, the usage of Outlook or SMTP Mail can be defined as well as standard Recipients, Subject line format, or special usage filters like Customer/Vendor/Contact /Responsibility Center and Language Code.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New to enter the settings in the Email Distribution Setup card view.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click New to enter the settings in the Email Distribution Setup card view.

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Email Distribution Setup card are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Email Distribution Setup card are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the code from the Email Distribution Codes page.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the code from the Email Distribution Codes page.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the description of the code from the Email Distribution Codes page.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the description of the code from the Email Distribution Codes page.

trans-unit.source: Limits the email distribution to a specific language; defaults from a language code assigned to the customer/vendor/contact in the Use for Code field.

seg-source.mrk: Limits the email distribution to a specific language; defaults from a language code assigned to the customer/vendor/contact in the Use for Code field.

trans-unit.source: Limits the email distribution to a specific customer/ vendor/contact/responsibility center.

seg-source.mrk: Limits the email distribution to a specific customer/ vendor/contact/responsibility center.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the customer/vendor/contact/responsibility center to which the email distribution applies.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the customer/vendor/contact/responsibility center to which the email distribution applies.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if Outlook or SMTP is used for emailing.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if Outlook or SMTP is used for emailing.

trans-unit.source: Additional settings for SMTP are accessible when Mail Type = SMTP and Sender = Fixed. Refer to section “SMTP Setup in Email Distribution Setup” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Additional settings for SMTP are accessible when Mail Type = SMTP and Sender = Fixed.
Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#SMTP" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“SMTP Setup in Email Distribution Setup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the format to be used for the subject line. The first two options are generated automatically while the third is manually defined.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the format to be used for the subject line.
The first two options are generated automatically while the third is manually defined.

trans-unit.source: Company Name - Source Type - Source No.

seg-source.mrk: Company Name - Source Type - Source No.

trans-unit.source: Recipient Name - Source Type - Source No.

seg-source.mrk: Recipient Name - Source Type - Source No.

trans-unit.source: Subject Text – defined in the Subject Text field.

seg-source.mrk: Subject Text – defined in the Subject Text field.

trans-unit.source: User-defined text, may contain placeholders to use dynamic parts in the Subject line and as well as in the Email Body Text. The possible placeholders are:

seg-source.mrk: User-defined text, may contain placeholders to use dynamic parts in the Subject line and as well as in the Email Body Text.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the Send E-Mail dialog message will not appear prior to sending the email. Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Send Email.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Send Email” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the Send E-Mail dialog message will not appear prior to sending the email.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Send Email.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Send Email” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the report request page will appear before the email creation process begins.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the report request page will appear before the email creation process begins.

trans-unit.source: If selected, a dialog appears asking the type of distribution that should be used. The supported options are Email and PDF; Fax is not supported yet.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, a dialog appears asking the type of distribution that should be used.
The supported options are Email and PDF; Fax is not supported yet.

trans-unit.source: Indicates who is sending the email. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates who is sending the email.

trans-unit.source: Current User – the email of the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV user is the sender.

seg-source.mrk: Current User – the email of the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV user is the sender.

trans-unit.source: Fixed – a specific email/user is entered in the Sender Address and Sender Name fields.

seg-source.mrk: Fixed – a specific email/user is entered in the Sender Address and Sender Name fields.

trans-unit.source: Mail Type must be set to SMTP to use a fixed sender.

seg-source.mrk: Mail Type must be set to SMTP to use a fixed sender.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the email address if Sender = Fixed.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the email address if Sender = Fixed.

trans-unit.source: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the sender.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the sender.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the name of the sender if Sender = Fixed.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the name of the sender if Sender = Fixed.

trans-unit.source: Indicates who is receiving the email. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates who is receiving the email.

trans-unit.source: Automatic – the email address is determined by the configuration; typically the contact in the document.

seg-source.mrk: Automatic – the email address is determined by the configuration; typically the contact in the document.

trans-unit.source: Fixed – a specific email is entered in the Recipient Address field.

seg-source.mrk: Fixed – a specific email is entered in the Recipient Address field.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the email address if Recipient Type = Fixed.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the email address if Recipient Type = Fixed.

trans-unit.source: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the recipient.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the recipient.

trans-unit.source: Indicates a fixed email address of users to which the email distribution should also be sent.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates a fixed email address of users to which the email distribution should also be sent.

trans-unit.source: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the recipient.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Send E-Mail icon to create an email to the recipient.

trans-unit.source: SMTP Setup in Email Distribution Setup

seg-source.mrk: SMTP Setup in Email Distribution Setup

trans-unit.source: For easier handling of SMTP delivery, the Email Distribution Setup page contains the necessary SMTP fields for each record when Mail Type = SMTP and Sender = Fixed.

seg-source.mrk: For easier handling of SMTP delivery, the Email Distribution Setup page contains the necessary SMTP fields for each record when Mail Type = SMTP and Sender = Fixed.

trans-unit.source: : Email Distribution Setup page highlighting actions and fields related to SMTP

seg-source.mrk: : Email Distribution Setup page highlighting actions and fields related to SMTP

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if Mail Type = SMTP and the Sender field = Fixed, then the information in the Email Distribution Setup page is used. If the Sender field = Current User, then the information in the standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV SMTP Mail Setup table is used.

seg-source.mrk: Therefore, if Mail Type = SMTP and the Sender field = Fixed, then the information in the Email Distribution Setup page is used.
If the Sender field = Current User, then the information in the standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV SMTP Mail Setup table is used.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the Email Distribution Setup (card/list) pages contains two SMTP actions (“Apply Office 365 Server Settings” and “Test Email Setup”) to assist with SMTP mail setup.

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, the Email Distribution Setup (card/list) pages contains two SMTP actions (“Apply Office 365 Server Settings” and “Test Email Setup”) to assist with SMTP mail setup.

trans-unit.source: Attachments can be assigned to the specific email distribution setup entries. In the Email Attachment Setup page, enter a new line for each attachment that needs to be assigned to the email distribution entry. Along with a description, optional starting and ending dates can be set to indicate the length of time for which the attachment should be included in emails.

seg-source.mrk: Attachments can be assigned to the specific email distribution setup entries.
In the Email Attachment Setup page, enter a new line for each attachment that needs to be assigned to the email distribution entry.
Along with a description, optional starting and ending dates can be set to indicate the length of time for which the attachment should be included in emails.

trans-unit.source: : Email Attachment Setup with attached Word documents and graphic

seg-source.mrk: : Email Attachment Setup with attached Word documents and graphic

trans-unit.source: The File Name field is populated with the name of the uploaded file but can be changed. Once uploaded, attachments can be downloaded for review.

seg-source.mrk: The File Name field is populated with the name of the uploaded file but can be changed.
Once uploaded, attachments can be downloaded for review.

trans-unit.source: Attached file(s) will be included in the emails sent using this distribution, along with the Microsoft Dynamics NAV document.

seg-source.mrk: Attached file(s) will be included in the emails sent using this distribution, along with the Microsoft Dynamics NAV document.

trans-unit.source: : Email to be sent with PDF and attachments

seg-source.mrk: : Email to be sent with PDF and attachments

trans-unit.source: cc|text module functionality can be used on each email distribution entry to define the text to appear in the body of the email; this includes text formatting options like bold, underline, italic and some colors as well as placeholders (refer to section “Placeholders in Body Text” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: cc|text module functionality can be used on each email distribution entry to define the text to appear in the body of the email; this includes text formatting options like bold, underline, italic and some colors as well as placeholders (refer to section “Placeholders in Body Text” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: To create or open an existing Text Module Card for a line, click Navigate > Text Module > New or Edit.

seg-source.mrk: To create or open an existing Text Module Card for a line, click Navigate > Text Module > New or Edit.

trans-unit.source: : cc|text module text added to the PURCHORDER Email Distribution code with no filters

seg-source.mrk: : cc|text module text added to the PURCHORDER Email Distribution code with no filters

trans-unit.source: If an Email Distribution Setup is allocated, the data in the setup is used for email creation. Otherwise, the schedule that exists in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV is used. In both cases, the Send E-Mail dialog box opens with settings from Email Distribution Setup (or Outlook/SMTP Mail Setup). If the Email Distribution Setup is used, the dialog box will also display the cc|text module text added to the setup pages. From the dialog box, the email can be sent or if using Outlook, can be opened for editing before sending.

seg-source.mrk: If an Email Distribution Setup is allocated, the data in the setup is used for email creation.
Otherwise, the schedule that exists in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV is used.
In both cases, the Send E-Mail dialog box opens with settings from Email Distribution Setup (or Outlook/SMTP Mail Setup).
If the Email Distribution Setup is used, the dialog box will also display the cc|text module text added to the setup pages.
From the dialog box, the email can be sent or if using Outlook, can be opened for editing before sending.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the current “cc|text module” documentation for more information about setting up and using cc|text module functionality.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to the current “cc|text module” documentation for more information about setting up and using cc|text module functionality.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic “Example – Add Formatted Text to Sales Order Confirmation” on page 1 for information about using cc|formatted documents functionality with cc|text module.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic “Example – Add Formatted Text to Sales Order Confirmation” on page 1 for information about using cc|formatted documents functionality with cc|text module.

trans-unit.source: Placeholders (variables) can be used to enter information from the record into the email’s body text. These placeholders can be added to either the cc|text module lines or the cc|formatted documents text. The available placeholders are listed in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Placeholders (variables) can be used to enter information from the record into the email’s body text.
These placeholders can be added to either the cc|text module lines or the cc|formatted documents text.
The available placeholders are listed in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Document number / assembly number / transfer header number

seg-source.mrk: Document number / assembly number / transfer header number

trans-unit.source: Bank account number (for bank account statement only)

seg-source.mrk: Bank account number (for bank account statement only)

trans-unit.source: Buy-from/sell-to/bill-to name / assembly description / transfer-from name

seg-source.mrk: Buy-from/sell-to/bill-to name / assembly description / transfer-from name

trans-unit.source: Salutation according to the contact’s settings

seg-source.mrk: Salutation according to the contact’s settings

trans-unit.source: Fig. 7 is an example of placeholders added to cc|text module lines and the email created for the sales order confirmation using that text.

trans-unit.source: Fig. 8 is an example of placeholders added to the cc|formatted documents text and the email created for the sales order confirmation using that text.

trans-unit.source: To create an email using the “Send PDF as Email” function with text from the cc|text module, an Email Distribution Code must be entered on the relevant Report Selection entry. This can be done in the Report Selection page for Sales, Purchase, Reminder, Commission, and DACH functions.

seg-source.mrk: To create an email using the “Send PDF as Email” function with text from the cc|text module, an Email Distribution Code must be entered on the relevant Report Selection entry.
This can be done in the Report Selection page for Sales, Purchase, Reminder, Commission, and DACH functions.

trans-unit.source: : Email Distribution Code assigned to the Purchase Order in Report Selection - Purchase

seg-source.mrk: : Email Distribution Code assigned to the Purchase Order in Report Selection - Purchase

trans-unit.source: The custom report selections in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV can also be set up to use the Email Distribution functionality. On the Customer Card or Vendor Card, click Navigate > Document Layouts. The various sales or purchase documents can be set up with different email addresses and different Email Distribution Codes, each code with different cc|text module text.

seg-source.mrk: The custom report selections in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV can also be set up to use the Email Distribution functionality.
On the Customer Card or Vendor Card, click Navigate > Document Layouts.
The various sales or purchase documents can be set up with different email addresses and different Email Distribution Codes, each code with different cc|text module text.

trans-unit.source: : Standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV Document Layouts page with regular (TOCUSTOMER) and special (CUST30000) Email Distribution Codes for customer 30000

seg-source.mrk: : Standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV Document Layouts page with regular (TOCUSTOMER) and special (CUST30000) Email Distribution Codes for customer 30000
